meanings.definition: To injure the brain by a violent blow, shaking, or jarring.
meanings.sent1: The football player was concussed during the game.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake concussed the entire city.
meanings.sent3: The tree branch concussed the poor squirrel as it fell.
meanings.sent4: The loud music concussed my ears.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous clap concussed the silence of the night.

meanings.sent1: The earthquake caused the ground to concuss.
meanings.sent2: The angry toddler began to concuss his toy in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The blender seemed to concuss everything in the kitchen with its loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The storm concussed the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The explosion concussed the air with its force.
